value.title: Build conversation flows with multi-valued slots in Amazon Lex
value.excerpt: Multiple pieces of information are often required to complete a task or to process a query. For example, when talking to an insurance agent, a caller might ask, “Can you provide me quotes for home, auto, and boat?” The agent recognizes this as a list of policy types before continuing with the conversation.

value.title: AWS Announces General Availability of Amazon MemoryDB for Redis
value.excerpt: Amazon Web Services, Inc. (AWS), an Amazon.com, Inc. company (NASDAQ: AMZN), announced the general availability of Amazon MemoryDB for Redis, a fully managed, Redis-compatible, in-memory database. Amazon MemoryDB for Redis enables customers to achieve ultra-fast performance with high availability and durability for their most business-critical applications that require sub-millisecond response times.

value.title: Noodle.ai Joins AWS Partner Network to Build Supply Chain Resiliency for CPG Customers
value.excerpt: Noodle.ai, the leading provider of Flow Operations (FlowOps) software, today announced it has become an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Advanced Technology Partner to drive scale and efficiency for the supply chains of global consumer packaged goods (CPG) companies.

value.title: Machine Learning at the Edge with AWS Outposts and Amazon SageMaker
value.excerpt: As customers continue to come up with new use-cases for machine learning, data gravity is as important as ever. Where latency and network connectivity is not an issue, generating data in one location (such as a manufacturing facility) and sending it to the cloud for inference is acceptable for some use-cases.
